qas.question: In what year did Greece rejoin NATO?
Greece joined what later became the European Union when?
Earthquakes hit both Greece and Turkey in which year?

context: Meanwhile, <a0_0>Andreas Papandreou<a0_0/> founded the <a1_0>Panhellenic Socialist Movement<a1_0/> (PASOK) in response to Karamanlis's conservative New Democracy party, with the two political formations alternating in government ever since. Greece rejoined NATO in <a2_0>1980<a2_0/>. Greece became the tenth member of the European Communities (subsequently subsumed by the European Union) on <a3_0>1 January 1981<a3_0/>, ushering in a period of sustained growth. Widespread investments in industrial enterprises and heavy infrastructure, as well as funds from the European Union and growing revenues from tourism, shipping and a fast-growing service sector raised the country's standard of living to unprecedented levels. Traditionally strained relations with neighbouring Turkey improved when successive earthquakes hit both nations in <a4_0>1999<a4_0/>, leading to the lifting of the Greek veto against Turkey's bid for EU membership.
